bow: it made me feel ashamed poor moms anguish over diaper costs ll be the first to admit we struggle with diapers my husband works full time and we have two young kids my youngest is three months old and still has long time in diapers few weeks ago returned few bottles of shampoo for store credit at walmart to get him bag of diapers on wic and they used to have diaper banks when my daughter was small but they ca afford to do it anymore this is such problem for myself and mothers like me he goes through minimum diapers day and when there only 36 40 in pack that goes quickly someone somewhere needs to do something 11 98 for 40 diapers is not reasonable that is absurd and we absolutely ca afford it know there are families worse off than us and that scares me ve never had to make diaper stretch but the fact that some moms have to makes me really sad something really needs to be done about this cloth reason number one for us going cloth was the cost we paid total of less than 500 for all the diapers we use for our two boys we bought all of them second hand other considerations were the environment and their bottoms almost no diaper rashes with cloth ve read that it costs between 1200 1500 year for one kid no way it not that gross once you get used to it the pissy ones just go into the washer and the crappy ones have to be scraped into the toilet first but there are worse things in life than that edit forgot sentence deleted you should consider cloth diapers poverty sucks my family is middle class poor ca afford disposable diapers for two children so when my son was born we bought 400 worth of cloth diapers new and used about 35 total he is now years old and his sister who is months old wears the same ones so no new expenses there breastfeed and sometimes resort to pre hand washing poopy diapers to save on double run in the washer poverty is what it is do wait for someone else to do something about it for you seconding everything about this love the cloths also in the midwest and we always hear cloth really is that gross time consuming huge hassle think lot of people from my parents generation and older also do realize how much cloth diapers have changed and how easy it is now my mom wrestled with pinning prefolds on me for months before throwing in the towel when was kid but ours are all in one snap ons that literally take *seconds* to change also so much cuter that disposables we still use them over nights though thought wic provided diapers as well that really sucks that they do are there any women shelters near you that do any sort of diaper donations also if you stay home with your kids during the day have you looked into elimination communication it is convenient for all the time but it could help you cut down on the number of diapers you use while you are at home also not sure if this is good option for you if you are strapped for cash but amazon com allows you to do subscribe and save thing with diapers and saw them as low as 18 per diaper when you are currently paying 29 per diaper even if you do use the subscription think you can still get them for like 19 20 per diaper depending on the brand one last thing is that are you signed up with the major diaper manufactures to get their coupons even if its only that could be helpful sorry for the unsolicited advice just feel horrible that you are struggling with diapers but how are they supposed to come up with the money for the cloth diapers when she having hard time coming up with the money for the 12 pack of diapers think its hard for lot of unwealthy families to come up with that initial investment money for the cloth diapers its still cheaper though so hopefully she can maybe save up for them and find them secondhand on like craigslist or something more of meant that someone should initiate more easily accessible diaper bank or diaper exchange or something the last thing do is wait around for someone to solve my problems struggle but do beg for handouts clean houses on the weekends to make little extra cash which usually goes right towards diapers and wipes also breastfeed because formula is another insanely expensive infant expense could not agree more cloth diapered two of my kids about the same cost as you and you can get diaper sprayer to spray the poop into the toilet so easy and never touched poop did not cloth diaper my first and remember freaking out for running out of diapers and having to make late night run to get more never ever worried about that with cloth and the cost did freak me out too we never had extra money and budgeting for diapers was always there but once we switched to cloth it was like burden was lifted there are many places out there that give away cloth diapers to those in need most are locally based but if you search there are those that are happy to help know websites like diaperswappers years ago had free for shipping for just free forum as well have traded many things for diapers to help off set the cost yes it can be work but worth the effort ve seen those sprayers any good mean does the spray you know get sprayed around we ve got these awesome hemp inserts for overnight they work perfectly never leak we looked into cloth with my first son when took into account water soap and buying them it actually was cheaper for us lived in an area where utilities were really high we ve moved since then though and think it probably would have been cheaper here but hooked on the convenience thought add this there is an organization that helps provide diapers if anyone wants to donate http www happybottoms org content donate dollars they are fantastic the one had you could control the flow force of the water think most people just do know about the modern options you have with cloth they think of the old school ones with the horrible rubber pants do know that cloth has saved me tons of money omg cute print must buy but it certainly *can* if done right not sure why it not more promoted it would be nice if wic offices and similar had information about it easily available think lot of moms especially young moms do even consider it or know it an option they re great there is sometimes some spray drip or mess but keep bleach wipes in the bathroom and it not big deal sprayers can also double as bidets which can be awesome was able to save up mine during my pregnancy but realize this is accessible to everyone that being said ten pack of prefolds is 12 at target and reusable packet of vinyl covers is on amazon cloth diapering can be done very cheaply too the problem is really the stigma and hassle that people do want to deal with more than the cost diaper banks exist cloth diaper swaps are available online my community even has mother exchange sell page on facebook and plenty of mom groups offer everything from stroller rentals baby carriers to used baby clothes just look or start one if you do have one in your area did not mean to cause offense we have to do what we must to provide for our children these things exist though and it takes minimal googling effort to find them if you are going to use cloth then use luvs when had my daughter we spent stupid amount on diapers and she would still wake up soaked through in the am eventually switched to luvs they are cheaper and never had any leaks if you re too poor to have reliable washing machine the hassle is pretty formidable lot of poor single moms work lot and asking them to commit the time to cloth diaper also might show lack of understanding of their situations the other great thing about hemp is that it gets more absorbent the more you wash it and the fibers relax so over time they actually become better to use which think is awesome just as side note but especially in nordic countries where more provisions are given for mothers and babies cloth diapers are given out one would assume for just this reason unfortunately the us is just horribly behind the ball on this one there not really any stigma attached to cloth diapers these days the only people know who use clothies are relatively affluent crunchy granola type mothers the hassle is the real issue and lorakeeth is absolutely right about it it big hassle already for the middle class but if you have to add in additional trips to the laundrimat both the time and monetary expense thereof it gets to be downright undoable for someone trying to work two jobs and care for an infant they also have things like high quality subsidized child care and guaranteed maternity leave *sigh* consider myself poor middle class and have always had access to sink line washer or laundromat so suppose do really understand poor single mom perspective because ve never been there very few people are too poor to access soap and water though in america and that is really what it comes down to that and time which realize is limited resource but if you ca spare 30 min every other day to wash diapers in the name of living within your means then priorities may have to be reorganized would kill for that maternity leave for mothers and fathers my boyfriend got fired for taking me to the hospital when was so dehydrated from gh that had to sit on ivs almost the entire day because we re not married feels really bad man affluent crunchy granola type mothers is stigma am neither affluent nor granola and yet use cloth diapers live in one income household that leaves us barely making ends meet every month ve resorted to handwashing diapers in the tub to save on water and detergent ca imagine two jobs and an infant because ve never been there and truly respect those who live that reality because damn that hard but 30 minutes every other day and clothes line really ca be that prohibitively undoable interesting thought that the only kind of cloth diapering was like the bumgenious ones where the whole thing went in the washer did quite realize you could do the prefold with cover that makes it sound much more reasonable if you buy packs of prefolds and packs of vinyl covers you could probably get days worth of diapers you just do load of diapers every other day right guess its probably more work then the all in one thing but still better than spending the money if you do have the money up vote this all day long my mom was single mother who worked long hours and cloth diapered me and my sister it all comes down to priorities as stay at home mom on tight budget potty training my daughter at two has been such financial blessing struggling for diapers sucks not he op but cloth diapering takes me an additional hour week do have washing machine and dryer but have to fold all my diapers from the dryer use flats it would take maybe hours week for laundromat including washing and folding it is something everyone can do but it makes more sense to me to spend 300 on cloth diapers that you can use for more than one baby and then take few hours week to wash them think that saving hundreds of dollars and not having to spend time trying to sell things or find ways to afford disposable diapers would be big incentive to take the time to do cloth it not just that many day area wo allow cloth diapers we ultimately decided against cloth diapers for our youngest because we could find daycare that would accept children in them bumgenious is like the high end in cloth diapering ca afford them there are cheaper pocket diaper options that are low as diaper at gogreen and target add free shipping and coupons then its almost criminal not to have mostly gogreen diapers few donated no name brand one hand made 20 prefolds and 10 or so vinyl covers that rotate between two kids also have about 15 square towel diapers that use in pinch cut towel squares hemmed at the edges stick em under vinyl cover and no one can tell the difference too poor to literally piss and poop money away there are also lot of diaper brands you can buy sunbabies for example that are like 36 for 12 we cd and made it work on 12 at first and now have quite few more we did have our own washer however seconding subscribe and save pay 19 per diaper for pampers swaddlers in the 140 pack looks like you can get luvs for 15 per diaper in the 180 pack either way buying 36 packs is waste of money edit maybe should switch to luvs alva baby diapers are piece so cheap you do have to buy them all up front buy few at time the cost saving is extremely significant there also the lovely it warm out skip the diaper all together method fan right there with you was in this situation as well hell it got both my kids out of diapers faster too that what was thinking buying diapers in such small quantities generally causes prices to increase also ve heard many people express their distaste for luvs but also many people express deep affection for them maybe when you are trying them out you could buy small pack and see how you like them only good reason to buy small pack imo this kind of reminds me of discussions ve seen participated in online about healthy eating it always goes op says it too expensive to eat healthy commenters suggest lots of ways that healthy eating can be accomplished on tight budget op says they ca do any of that and here why rinse repeat problem with cloth is that those who can not afford disposables often do have access to an in home washer amp dryer if you re single working mother an extra trip or load at the laundromat is huge burden clothes lines are easily doable if you do have yard do have yard hang clothes on the shower curtain rod this is definitely true and the other thing forgot to think about is the startup cost 400 at one time may seem like bargain compared to 2k total for diapers but for some people scraping together all that money at once is really hard they have some good little manual washing systems and washing by hand can work great but it would be huge time and energy suck which low income mothers would probably not be able to deal with without huge mental stress we had issues with diapers when our first child came so the second time around would buy two packs week my whole pregnancy they lasted year then had two in diapers and they ended up wearing the same size for two years still ca do the 28 box of 138 at target every time need them thank heavens the target debit card takes days to come out of my bank account this is very true even if you have shared in apartment building washer do think be comfortable washing shitty diapers in it yes we do subscribe and save too love it find it really interesting that the author of the article never mentioned the cloth option it infuriates me to read something like this since attempted to donate bunch of cloth diapers and some unused disposables my daughter had outgrown to women shelter and was told that they were accepting them it mentioned in the 18th paragraph an unemployed and very un wealthy cloth diapering mom checking in bought my cloth diapers secondhand and got them for less than half price got bumgenius one size for around 10 apiece plus diaper pail wet bag big tub of detergent and liners thrown in for the deal know there are also diaper swap meets exchanges run by local cloth diaper shop where folks can get diapers for super cheap there are also services have read about them but do remember the names where they collect used cloth diapers fix them up replace elastic velcro etc and give them to those in need know not everyone is fortunate enough to have access to these services but they help lot of people think cloth takes me about 90 minutes total per week as unemployed right now see those 90 minutes as part of my work and the money that save as my earnings not that really have very much money to spend but at least not going into debt pampers are worth the extra 04 now see it it buried so deep in there guess it really is an after thought using cloth myself for environmental reasons but it definitely is cheaper and when my washing machine was broker had no problem taking the diapers to the laundromat and it really was extra time because had to take the rest of our clothes there anyway we tried cloth at first but every cloth nappy we had leaked our eldest is long and lanky and they leaked every time we tried which was many times we then moved on to going diaperless which is lot of work initially but is much easier in the long run we ve been quite lucky think with both boys we do get many leaks and only if the diaper is super full ve read about diaperless but after one afternoon just letting the older boy roam free this was while ago it was big nope for me good on you for persevering some people also do have access to washing machine and to work full time and hand wash cloth diapers every night might not be in the books for them can easily see why lower class family can not do cloth diapers nothing is ever black and white suggest buying the diapers that aldi sells switched from target up and up to aldi lullabies after my daughter started getting bad rashes the aldi diapers are 99 for almost 40 of them they are really good diapers too super absorbent they have the same elastic thing on the back like the huggies and the up and ups really like them buy almost everything from aldi because make out with about 899 every month after taxes my rent is 681 and the rest goes to bills and food and baby stuff it really hard to make everything work every month and will be getting bonus at the end of the year which will go long long way for me but currently am single mom and have to do what works like the aldi diapers more than the target diapers for lot of reasons one of the biggest reasons is that aldi diapers do have certain gel in them that most other diapers do have this gel can cause rashes aldi diapers do have it and my daughters rash was gone almost overnight about to launch my website which will have lot of prices and useful tips for stretching your dollar am doing lot of experiments around my house to be more frugal switched from body wash to bar soap use targets brand of laundry detergent buy almost all of my groceries at aldi and probably going to start making my own febreeze and detergents the bar soap thing has been huge thing for me on tangent here sorry it smells better it makes you smell better you do waste anything bars can last months or more and they are way cheaper than bodywash anyway hope you figure the diaper thing out its tough sorry but that dose show level of privilage that you have even as poor middle class soap toothpaste shampoo etc is not something that is usually provided for on assitance programs to the point where providing items like that to shelter or food bank is god send ve known of too many cases where items like that where stolden so that the person could have basic hygine there is sadly very big cut off in what is around between poor and destitute for me pampers is worth the dear god why is she breaking out from every other brand so she in the stupidly expensives ones because all other kinds end up triggering her allergies poor girl with her in day care that was our only real option thank god my mother has bough dipers few times for us this this is what most of the people on the thread are missing 95 of day care options espically the ones that are cheaper or take the day care assistance will not take any child who is cloth diapered frankly it huge burden on the workers to ask it which is why they do when you are very poor and work you do have options like that ve never claimed to understand absolute poverty lucky ve never been there this however does not invalidate my points on the affordability and accessibility of cloth diapers if you ca afford toothpaste and are living on welfare and assistance well you ca afford anything disposable or cloth however for those of us attempting to live within our means however meager they may be cloth is godsend just wanted to share same here we use pampers overnight and then another one till his morning poop also whenever we go out cloth diapers during the day evening cheap diapers give him rash or do even hold in the contents works for us that not how your comment is coming across if you want to preach the good points of cloth to which there are many that is one thing but the rest of your comment ignores the realities of life cloth diaper cost less money over time *if* you can aford the start up or find someone giving them away *if* you have the ability to wash and dry them often *if* you have access to washer and dryer or have place to dry clothing where some one dos need that space *if* you have day care that lets you use cloth diapers not reality for most people urban poor you often do have access to laudry that lets you wash them there or the places to hang them after hand washing you do have day care that lets you use cloth it sad but there are some points where short term vs long term have to be looked at walmart sells 50ct diapers for white cloud brand it would definitely help if you bought the generics call 211 and see what they have for diaper assistance in your area places like churches and crisis parenting programs often give them out this article really touched me decided that for my son 1st birthday instead of presents for him seriously we do need more stuff he just wants ends up playing with boxes and bottles and other nonsense we re asking people to bring diapers that we will donate to local agency have found the right distribution partner in my area but ll keep looking if you re in position to please think about doing this for some moms in your area local food pantry or resource center some communities call them community houses could let you know how to get them in the hands of families that could use them http www givingdiapersgivinghope org it actually not any more of burden than dispoasble worked for time in daycare in an infant room and the cloth was the same the only difference was that they provided the cloth wipes and instead of throwing it away we put it in their wetbag people who think it harder on daycares tend to be the ones that have had experience with crazy parents wanting the worker to spray the diaper out first which is laziness on the parent and not needed at all that can be done at home with no issue there is no poop on them when you wash them what are you talking about when you scrape diaper that previously was covered in poop there will invariably still be poop on the nappy perhaps not chunks but definitely poop that why you wash them to get rid of the poop no you rinse them either with sprayer connected to your toilet or outside with your hose or swish them in the toilet when you wash there is no poop on the diaper unless you count things you ca see with the naked eye no sprayer although after this thread going to buy one no way my wife she does the scraping is going to swish the nappy around the loo sprayers are awesome we used to hose them outside because did want to swish either
